website_summaries.verdict: Your best choice if you're looking for an accurate, easy-to-read dial caliper on a budget.
pros: Display is in fractions, so you don't have to do any math
Continues to give accurate readings for years if cared for properly
cons: This caliper probably won't last you very long if you're not taking good care of it

customer_reviews.title: Spend more money on something better!!!
customer_reviews.text: Not what I expected. Razor sharp edges, piece of junk case, rough operation and generally poor QC. Buy something more expensive as you will be disappointed in this.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great for a cabinetmaker/furniture maker
customer_reviews.text: Great for a cabinetmaker/furniture maker. Its a lot easier for me to read fractions than thousandths of an inch. Further, I don't really ever have a need to read to the nearest thousandth, the nearest 64th is good enough! Fit and finsish is really good, and it slides smoothly. Comes with nice case too. Price is right. I see no reason to pay $100 + for a caliper that gets used for carpentry.
customer_reviews.author: Person

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good product for the price. Excellent for attaining fractional readouts, but for close tolerance work, I still find myself reaching for my decimal calipers.
customer_reviews.author: CoolFins

customer_reviews.title: low cost but  well made
customer_reviews.text: i use for wood work in my little shop AND METAL work I have two of this fractional caliper very accurate
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one to replace a 'cheapie' digital unit that went crazy. It seemed to imagine that it was twice as long as it really was, and constantly ate batteries. So, back to the 'good old days' of dial calipers for me from now on. No batteries required and accurate enough for my reloading bench without drifting as it's used. My only 'complaint' is that the action is a little rough, but not unexpected for this price, right?
customer_reviews.author: Silas Longshot

customer_reviews.title: fine for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because I am tired of my cheap digital one having a dead battery when I need it. This one measures and returns to zero just fine. Operation is not as smooth as I could wish, but it moves evenly with no hitches or loose spots. I had to tighten the screw that holds the thumb roller assembly, and it is holding so far. Overall, this is fine for the moderate-precision tasks for which I will use it. Glad I didn't spend more - or less. .
customer_reviews.author: Joe Doaks

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: Have been using it for 9 years but not very frequently. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Misha

customer_reviews.title: Great caliper. Gunna purchase another one.
customer_reviews.text: Very accurate. Mechanically smooth. Great price. What else could a person want? I've owned my Oshlun for around two years and I use it a couple of times per month. Some folks have given this item poor reviews. All I can say is that my unit functions like a champ. Maybe their units where defective?
customer_reviews.author: Money Leaker

customer_reviews.title: Only flaw is that the wider component of the probe ...
customer_reviews.text: Only flaw is that the wider component of the probe flange is a bit too prominent making it harder to measure thinner areas. Otherwise bullet proof.
customer_reviews.author: nunuyabizness

customer_reviews.title: Good starter caliper
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Accurate and smooth. Sometimes there is a little bit of sliding in the gearing that moves the caliper but it doesn't hurt the measurements. The depth gauge function is a little difficult to use sometimes but you figure it out. If you want a decent caliper that will grow with you then this is a good selection. I don't use it everyday, it is for small weekend projects but I will put up a long term review later.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read marks for 64th" increments and 1/16
customer_reviews.text: Easy to read marks for 64th" increments and 1/16, 1/8, 3/16 and so on are labeled on the outer scale. 100ths are easy to read on the green outer outer scale. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: Mister Jigs

customer_reviews.title: Great caliper, been using it for over 2 years ...
customer_reviews.text: Great caliper, been using it for over 2 years and wanted another one for home. I work with imperial measurements so this product is great for me!
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: It is an excellent tool. Unfortunately, the case was broken during shipping but it did not impair the tool.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Roath

customer_reviews.title: grear
customer_reviews.text: Perfect in this world of antimetricism. Just don't drop it.
customer_reviews.author: Rumenocity

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold position
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't buy this again. It doesn't hold a zero position. I mean, when you zero the calipers, then open them a few inches, then close them the dial doesn't return to zero. Something inside the mechanism is not holding position.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Sent me defective used item
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance and bought a used item. Dial totally didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Amarillo by morning

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Accuracy is great. Quality is pretty solid. Don't really care for the thumbwheel, but not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: David Y.

customer_reviews.title: It is a good product but they don't have a left handed option
customer_reviews.text: It is a good product but they don't have a left handed option. So for me it's really awkward to use. But I couldn't find any analog left handed option.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher T Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Oshlun MTDCT-06 6 inch stainless steel fractional dail caliper
customer_reviews.text: I like the accuracy of this product. It has a variety of functions such as depth gauge, inside measurements, outside measurements. The dial is easy to read, calibrated in 64ths of an inch. I do a lot of wood turning and this caliper makes my work more accurate. It is truly a fine tool. It locks in position making assuring accuracy in use.
customer_reviews.author: Genealogist

customer_reviews.title: Does the job well
customer_reviews.text: I am a professional woodworker. My pieces fit together with dry fit precision. My regular dial caliper failed. I used a spare to get me through the pinch; not great but it worked in a pinch. I ordered this caliper because it has both fractional and decimal identifiers. It is solid and easy to read and to work with. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Hikingstaffs

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Have not used it a whole lot so far but I'm loving it. I've found more uses for it than I imagined. It's solid. Feels like quality in my hand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Measures Up
customer_reviews.text: Accurate and easy to use. One of my top woodworking tools.
customer_reviews.author: Bob P

customer_reviews.title: At last a caliper for the wood technician great tool. Has all the accuracy we need in ...
customer_reviews.text: At last a caliper for the wood technician great tool . Has all the accuracy we need in our cabinet shop. Thanks much.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but good
customer_reviews.text: I like it, it's cheap and works very well. You'll need to sand down the sharp edges and loctite the thumb wheel screw.
customer_reviews.author: ootsae

customer_reviews.title: Tool, measurement
customer_reviews.text: This was a good item for an engineer or anyone who needs to measure diameters, internal or external, or other small increments. Good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Dippy Diner

customer_reviews.title: You can tell
customer_reviews.text: This caliper is ok to use in a pinch, but compared to a Mitutoyo or Starrett, this one is much more cheaply made
customer_reviews.author: David J. Scaltreto

customer_reviews.title: Seems to made cheap.
customer_reviews.text: The middle part of the slide pops up and it just seems cheaply made. I think that it can be used as advertised but I feel for the price there should be better quality put into this item. I have a 19 dollar digital that feels better than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Mike H.

customer_reviews.title: Every Woodworker Should Have One of These
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps not precise enough for an engineer, these are much more accurate than a person eyeballing a depth, width or length with a tape measure. I keep mine handy on the top of my workbench....used daily.
customer_reviews.author: Woodworker

customer_reviews.title: Excellent caliper.  No batteries to fail.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Well made. Easy to read. Decent price. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate
customer_reviews.text: It is a very useful tool, easy to use and to read. It is very accurate and helps prevent mistakes.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Some minor issues
customer_reviews.text: This dial caliper is an ok selection. It is very accurate however the gears it slides on are not cut out very well and is therefore sometimes difficult to slide.
customer_reviews.author: D Savage

customer_reviews.title: Classic
customer_reviews.text: Caliper was delivered quickly. Yea! It is easy to read and use. I like it because it has a classic dial on it (as opposed to new digital ones). I don't really need the fractions on the dial but it is convienent for me when I need a quick and dirty measurement. (its not really that dirty ;) I have to admit that it gets me a little respect to have it at work. ( I am a female engineer and I think the men here think it is cool I have one.)
customer_reviews.author: Rain

customer_reviews.title: Good, inexspensive dial caliper
customer_reviews.text: I've used this same type in school last year and I decided I needed one for myself and got this one. There aren't any problems with it, it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: M. Goczalk

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the money
customer_reviews.text: I love precision joinery in woodwork not just because its functional and more durable but because it's beautiful. For years I have been using a tape measure and square but kept seeing and hearing from other would be craftsmen that the caliper was the way to go for greater joinery precision. I have been looking for a caliper that would offer the features and quality without the an over-the-top price tag. I have been very pleased with the Oshlun fractional dial caliper. It is solidly built, easy to operate and read, and adds the accuracy I was looking for. I gave it 4 stars just because you can always spend more for something a little better . . .
customer_reviews.author: Greenebro

customer_reviews.title: Danny
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product and very easy to use and read. I would recommend this product to anyone that needs a Caliper for house hold use
customer_reviews.author: Zemo K3

customer_reviews.title: Dial Caliper
customer_reviews.text: Very good unit, easy to read, use, and interpret. Great for general use in all areas of life for a handyman.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Shows dimensionsin inches
customer_reviews.text: Woodworker have a maxim: measure twice, cit once. If you measure twice with a caliper that reads in hundrediths, you will probably make them same error toich converting to 3/8 ". This one reads in the units use find in plans.
customer_reviews.author: M. L. Graham

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Tool
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure this tools works but it has a small plastic part on the bottom of the tool that keeps the tool from coming apart. I returned mine because this plastic part was broken when it arrived....however, who puts plastic parts on a metal tool that should be built to last a lifetime...Cheap tool from China!
customer_reviews.author: Rocco Odouche

customer_reviews.title: Low grade
customer_reviews.text: Low grade caliper. Plastic bezel, rough movement. It's not terrible, just low grade. Buy a used, high quality caliper and you'll be better served.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Tarver

customer_reviews.title: Great clear numbers and accuracy
customer_reviews.text: l will be using it for rings made of quality metals. Sizing right the first time is crucial. Only one screw to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Duvardo

customer_reviews.title: Kind of cheap, but the price is good, and works OK
customer_reviews.text: Kind of cheap, but for $20, what do you expect? Works OK, but there is a brass piece that seems to slide out quite a bit if you try to measure too fast. I wouldn't recommend this if you were going to use it a lot, but for the hobbyist (who likes dial calipers better), it's not a bad thing to have.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Fell apart right out of the package. Poorly made. I would not waste your money on this. There are other calipers for around the same price much better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Dave

customer_reviews.title: Spend the $100 and be done with it
customer_reviews.text: Broke while opening out of the packaging. Cheap. Crap. Go for something of quality of don't buy it, I learned the hard way. Brown and Sharpe is a good brand for these products
customer_reviews.author: jdemp87

customer_reviews.title: Oshlun Caliper
customer_reviews.text: The dial is very easy to read. It is not as smooth to operate as I was hoping, but for the price it is decent. I would put it on the same level of quality as those found at Harbor Freight.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney A. Brehm

customer_reviews.title: Defective Out of The Box
customer_reviews.text: Jaws would not open and close smoothly. Jaws would "hang" and then jump several graduations. No way this device could be used for precise measurements. Will return for a refund and try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

product_meta.title: Oshlun MTDCF-06 6-Inch Stainless Steel Fractional Dial Caliper
product_meta.description:
Size:6 Inch Fractional DialOur 6-Inch fractional dial caliper is made of stainless steel and comes in a plastic storage case. It features a 1-1/2-Inch dial that is easy to read when taking outside, inside, depth and step measurements. The dial face or bezel can be rotated to set zero anywhere on the scale and has a bezel clamp to lock the dial in place for making deviation measurements. The range per revolution is 1-Inch, with an accuracy of +/- 0.001-Inch, graduated in 0.010-Inch on the inner ring and 1/64-Inch on the outer ring. Also features a knurled thumb roller, positive lock and precision ground jaws.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Our 6-inch fractional dial caliper is made of stainless steel and comes in a plastic storage case. It features a 1-1/2-inch dial that is easy to read when taking outside, inside, depth and step measurements. The dial face or bezel can be rotated to set zero anywhere on the scale and has a bezel clamp to lock the dial in place for making deviation measurements. The range per revolution is 1-inch, with an accuracy of +/- 0.001-inch, graduated in 0.010-inch on the inner ring and 1/64-inch on the outer ring. Also features a knurled thumb roller, positive lock and precision ground jaws.
feature_bullets: 6-Inch Capacity Fractional Dial Caliper with Plastic Storage Case

specifications.Warranty Description: Oshlun guarantees all of our products against defects in material and workmanship for the life of the product. This does not include normal wear and tear or improper usage.
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars93 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
